subject: Public Speaking
title: Anaphora: The Power of Repetition
description: Learn Anaphora: The Power of Repetition in one minute.

hook.text: I have a dream. I have a dream. I have a dream. Repetition shouldn't work â€” but it's devastatingly effective.

buildup.text: Anaphora repeats a phrase at the start of successive sentences. It creates rhythm, emphasis, and emotional momentum.

discovery.text: The technique works because our brains crave patterns. Repetition creates expectation, and expectation creates focus.

twist.text: Overuse kills it. Three repetitions feel powerful. Ten feel like a stuck record. The art is knowing when to stop.

climax.text: Anaphora turns a list of ideas into a crescendo. Used well, it's the closest speaking gets to music.

punchline.text: Say it once to inform. Say it three times to transform.

quiz.question: What is anaphora?
options: Repeating a phrase at the start of successive sentences
